id: A Long Wait to Vote? Odds Are, You Were in the A-to-M Line
paragraph:
November 15, 2018When Mostafa Zamanian voted last week in Shorewood Hills, Wis., he got lucky: He was in the short line.“Of 19 in hallway, only two of us were N-Z and didn’t have to wait to vote,” he tweeted.Like other places, Mr. Zamanian’s precinct split up voters based on their last names. Those beginning with A to M were steered one way, while those...
